data.title: Stop putting desktop shortcut in automatic updates
data.body:
Windows 7 SP1 x64, Atom 0.159 updating

Steps
- Install Atom
  - desktop shortcut added
- Delete desktop shortcut
- Wait for Atom to be updated
- See "Downloading update" in Help Menu
-  **_super annoying, not-asked for, desktop shortcut reappears**_
- See "Restart and Install Update" in Help Menu

I know you want to do "zero user interaction updates" and be all Squirrel-y etc. but this is very annoying and pollutes my environment.

The update should not install a desktop shortcut. Maybe it should replace an existing shortcut _i.e._ update the pointer to from _old version_ to _new version_ but only _if the shortcut exists_. I could see the original installer placing a desktop short cut on the first install.

data.title: Reloading files changed externally only works once
data.body:
When a file is opened in Atom and then changed in some external application, such as git, it is reloaded only once. Subsequent external changes are not reflected in the Atom text buffer. 
## Repro Steps
1. Open a file in a git repository in Atom
2. Make some changes and save
3. Stash the changes: `git stash`
4. Reapply the changes: `git stash pop`

**Expected:** Atom should show the state of the file after step 2
**Actual:** Atom shows the original file, as it was after `git stash`
## Command History

```
     -0:03.5 editor:will-be-removed (atom-text-editor#editor.scrollSensitivity.editor.editor-colors.mini)
     -0:03.5 editor:detached (atom-text-editor#editor.undoGroupingInterval.editor.editor-colors.mini)
     -0:03.5 editor:will-be-removed (atom-text-editor#editor.undoGroupingInterval.editor.editor-colors.mini)
     -0:03.5 editor:detached (atom-text-editor.editor.editor-colors.mini)
     -0:03.5 editor:will-be-removed (atom-text-editor.editor.editor-colors.mini)
     -0:03.5 pane:item-removed (atom-pane.pane.active)
     -0:02.0 command-palette:toggle (input.hidden-input)
     -0:00.6 core:backspace (input.hidden-input)
     -0:00.0 core:confirm (input.hidden-input)
     -0:00.0 bug-report:open (input.hidden-input)
```
## Versions
- **Atom:**       0.158.0
- **Atom-Shell:** 0.19.4
- **OS:**         linux 3.16.0-28-generic
- **Misc**
  - apm  0.114.0
  - npm  1.4.4
  - node 0.10.33
  - python 2.7.8
  - git 2.1.0

---

<small>This report was created in and posted from the Atom editor using the package `bug-report` v0.5.3.</small>

data.title: Cannot start Atom from the Start menu
data.body:
Yep, it sounds strange, but that's my issue:
I can start Atom from the Run command or the command prompt, but not from the Start menu.

If I try that, the content of the editor is gray-blank (no tabs or anything) and the console is full of `Error: Module did not self-register.`.

I'm using Windows 8.1 x64 and Atom 0.161.0. I had installed the Chocolatey version before and it worked fine. I updated accordingly to [the blog post](http://blog.atom.io/2014/12/10/a-windows-installer-and-updater.html).
A clean installation (after removing `.atom`, `AppData\Local\atom` and `AppData\Roaming\Atom` in the user folder) didn't fix this issue.

data.title: Any support for custom UNICODE encodings?
data.body: By any chance, is there anyone interested to support custom encodings for the Unicode character set? By that I mean an alternative to UTF-8, but still decoding to Unicode.

data.title: Update didn't get applied
data.body:
I had two Atom windows open.  Clicked `Check for Update` and `Restart and install update` in the first one.  That window closed immediately but the second one waited maybe 5 seconds before showing the "Editor is not Responding" window and then closing a few seconds after that.  After Atom restarted, I'm still on 0.159.0 and the Help box again says to `Restart and install update`.

**Disclaimer**: I may or may not have actually been on 0.158.0 before updating, though that seems highly unlikely considering `atom.cmd` didn't get added until 0.159.0.

data.title: Atom doesn't respect/update OSX's find pasteboard / clipboard
data.body:
In OS X there's a separate pasteboard, NSFindPboard, used to keep search fields in sync.  The pasteboard gets updated when a search field changes or the user hits âŒ˜-E with text selected.  It can be pretty handy when you're searching through code for the same keyword, and most apps seem to generally respect it (Safari/XCode/Chrome/etc).  In general it seems like apps check it when they become active and update their search fields.

Chromium definitely supports NSFindPboard ([with some of the impl here](https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/git-svn/ui/base/cocoa/find_pasteboard.mm)), but I'm not sure that stuff is accessible at all from the Javascript layer.  

One option is just to shell out to pbpaste/pbcopy to get/update the pboard's contents, as in:

```
 pbpaste -pboard find
```

will dump the contents of NSFindPboard to stdout.

You could also technically get at it with NodeObjC, but that seems like overkill.

data.title: javascript: copy-pasting code containing switch statement indents weirdly
javascript: array contents not indented, and sometimes actually de-indents
data.body:
If you have this text in a javascript file:

```
a[]
```

and you place the cursor between the brackets and press enter, then two newlines will be inserted, and the cursor will be on the first inserted line but with the cursor on the same column with the `a` and `]` instead of being indented. Now the really frustrating part: if you try to add an indent and then press the `{` key, one or more indents are suddenly removed!

(Compare to what happens if you do the same with `a()`; two newlines are inserted and the cursor is indented.)

Atom version 0.158.0

data.title: Add guidance to syntax theme document about overriding the user's font choice
data.body:
1. Don't do it
2. If you must do it, see number 1
3. If you _really_ must do it, add `monospace` to the end of the `font-family` CSS rule

See #4598

data.title: Squirrel Installer - %LocalAppData%
data.body:
**Versions**
Atom: 0.158.0
OS: Windows 7

**Symptom**
I have downloaded AtomSetup.exe to install Atom 0.158.0 on my Windows machine at work (the at work part is key).  I am receiving the same error that Jessica notes in https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4583.

**Troubleshooting**
Opening up %LocalAppData% folder, I see a folder named 'SquirrelTemp'. If I follow Paul's final recommendation from https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4583

```
cd "%LocalAppData%\SquirrelTemp"
.\Update.exe --install .\atom-0.158.0-full.nupkg
```

**Issue**
When attempting to update using the exe, I get the following error returned in the Windows command prompt window: "This program is blocked by group policy.  For more information, contact your system administrator."

**Request**
My company blocks execution of exe's in the %LocalAppData% folder.  Is there any way to provide the ability to perform the extraction and installation in a folder outside of %LocalAppData%?  Does this functionality exist through command line options that I'm not aware of?

data.title: clipboard support on linux
data.body:
Hi,

It seems that the clipboard support in linux is broken
For example, I can not paste after deleting a character or to be more precise the deleted caracter is pasted.
It seems that internaly Atom uses a selection to select the character to delete and this updates the clipboard

Steps to reproduce:
1) type foo on a new editor window
2) select the text using the mouse or keybord
3) press ctrl + c
4) go to the end of line
5) hit backspace 1 time to delete the last O
6) press ctrl + v

I should get fofoo instead I get foo

I'm using fedora 20 and atom 0.157.0

data.title: Incorrect git status on OS X when accented characters are used in file names
data.body:
When an accented character (e.g. Ã¥Ã¤Ã¶, but probably other unicode characters as well) is used in a file name the git implementation in Atom on OS X thinks that the file is new, even though it exists on github. You can test with this repo (small, markdown files only):

`git clone https://github.com/morberg/recept.git`

Open root folder in atom and look at the incorrect status in the left tree navigation.

Problem is seen with Atom 0.158.0 on OS X 10.10.1:
![screen shot 2014-12-16 at 09 03 48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/956034/5450195/84f191da-8502-11e4-9f01-685719d6dc47.png)

Problem is _not_ seen with Atom 0.158.0 on Windows 7 SP 1.
![screen shot 2014-12-16 at 09 04 45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/956034/5450203/a25e5c1c-8502-11e4-977f-3f64a6bbb69a.png)

data.title: 'apm list --installed' no longer works on Windows (version v0.158.0)
data.body:
I recently noticed that the `apm list --installed` command no longer works in version v0.158.0. In previous versions I would get the following output:

```
C:\> apm list --installed --bare
go-plus@2.1.1
gocode@0.2.1
```

Now when I run the same command the program simply returns with no output. Running just `apm list` will display "Built-in Atom packages (79)" (`--bare` also works).

Here is the version information for APM

```
PS C:\> apm --version
apm  0.114.0
npm  1.4.4
node 0.10.33
python
git
visual studio
```
